what.title: What is this?
what.text: The Language Friends is a children’s English picture book series made for reading together at home.
what.extra: Each book teaches simple patterns through clear pictures and everyday moments.

who.title: Who is it for?
who.text: For young children and parents who want to enjoy English together, even if they don’t speak English confidently.
who.extra: Perfect for families who want a gentle routine they can start anytime.

why.title: Why is it safe and easy?
why.text: Simple sentences, gentle repetition, and friendly characters help children learn naturally, without pressure or testing.
why.extra: Kids can listen, repeat, and build confidence at their own pace.

how.title: How does this work?
how.text: Young children naturally absorb language through repeated exposure, sounds, and patterns rather than explanation or study.
how.extra: By hearing the same sentence structures again and again in a safe, familiar context, children build a strong foundation that allows language to grow naturally over time.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: A simple, gentle way for children to start learning English with confidence.

steps.title: Built for Natural Learning
steps.textA: The Language Friends is designed to help children learn English the same way they learn their first language through repetition, familiarity, and everyday experiences.
steps.textB: Instead of focusing on rules, children see and hear the same patterns again and again until they begin to feel natural.

steps.title: Made for Real Families
steps.textA: Each book is created for families who want to learn together, even if parents are not confident English speakers themselves.
steps.textB: The structure is simple and predictable, making it easy to read together without pressure or preparation.

steps.title: Learning Through Patterns
steps.textA: Each book focuses on a single sentence pattern and repeats it consistently, allowing children to recognize structure before meaning.
steps.textB: Clear visuals, color cues, and repeated layouts work together to help children intuitively connect words, patterns, and meaning without explanation.

charactersPreview.title: Meet The Language Friends!
charactersPreview.intro: Get to know the friendly characters who guide children through their English learning journey.

moko.name: Moko
moko.textA: Moko is adventurous and curious. He loves exploring new places and trying new things.
moko.textB: Moko helps children feel confident by showing that trying something new can be fun and exciting.

niko.name: Niko
niko.textA: Niko is gentle and thoughtful. She enjoys calm moments and learning at her own pace.
niko.textB: Niko shows children that it’s okay to take things slowly and learn in a comfortable way.

okja.name: Okja
okja.textA: Okja is energetic and playful. He loves moving, laughing, and exploring the world around him.
okja.textB: Okja helps children learn through action and reminds them that learning can be fun and active.

seriesPreview.title: Book Series
seriesPreview.subtitle: Each series focuses on a single sentence pattern that children naturally use in everyday language.

phrases.title: The Phrase Series
phrases.text: This series introduces the most common everyday phrases children hear and use, such as greetings and introductions, helping them recognize natural language chunks used in real situations rather than isolated words.

like.title: The Like Series
like.text: Each book in this series focuses on the single sentence pattern “___ likes ___,” repeating it across themed books such as fruits or vegetables so children build confidence by recognizing the same structure with different familiar nouns.

verb.title: The Verb Series
verb.text: This series teaches basic action verbs through the repeated pattern “___ ___s,” sometimes with an object added, allowing children to intuitively connect movement, action, and meaning through consistent visual repetition.

adjective.title: The Adjective Series
adjective.text: Children learn descriptive language through the repeated structure “___ is ___,” using clear emotional or visual states so adjectives are understood through context rather than explanation.

noun.title: The Noun Series
noun.text: This series focuses on ownership and objects using the pattern “___ has a ___,” with each book centered on a clear noun category such as stationery or everyday items to reinforce meaning through repetition.

stayConnected.title: Let’s Keep Learning Together
stayConnected.subtitle: The Language Friends is designed to grow with your child and support their English journey step by step.
stayConnected.newsletter: Get updates about new books, activities, and upcoming releases.

about.title: About The Language Friends
about.intro: The Language Friends is a gentle English learning project designed to help children feel confident, curious, and comfortable using English in their everyday lives.

approach.title: Our Approach
approach.text: We believe children learn best through familiarity, repetition, and positive experiences. Instead of memorization or pressure, our approach focuses on simple patterns, clear visuals, and friendly repetition that builds confidence over time.

learning.title: How Children Learn With Us
learning.text: Each book introduces a small set of words and sentence patterns through everyday situations. By seeing and hearing the same structures again and again, children naturally begin to understand and use English without fear or stress.

characters.title: Meet the Characters
characters.text: The Language Friends are friendly guides who help children feel safe and motivated. Each character has a unique personality that reflects different learning styles and emotions, helping children connect naturally with the language.

parents.title: For Parents
parents.text: Designed with parents in mind, The Language Friends supports shared learning moments. You don’t need to be fluent in English. The books guide both you and your child through simple, meaningful experiences.

closing.title: A Gentle Start to English
closing.text: The Language Friends is not about perfection or testing. It’s about curiosity, confidence, and enjoying the journey of learning together.

books.title: Our Book Series
books.intro: Each series is designed around a simple language pattern children naturally use in everyday life. All books follow the same structure to reduce cognitive load and build confidence through familiarity.

like.title: The Like Series
like.description: Children learn the sentence pattern “I like ___” through familiar foods, objects, and activities they already recognize.
like.howItWorks: Each book focuses on one clear preference. The character’s expression and actions visually reinforce what they like.
like.visualApproach: Characters are shown enjoying or choosing familiar things, making the meaning easy to understand without explanation.

verb.title: The Verb Series
verb.description: This series introduces simple action verbs through movement, play, and daily routines children already experience.
verb.howItWorks: Each book highlights one action. The character’s body movement clearly shows what the verb means.
verb.visualApproach: Characters are illustrated mid-action to make verbs intuitive and energetic.

adjective.title: The Adjective Series
adjective.description: Children explore describing words like big, small, happy, and sad using clear visual contrasts.
adjective.howItWorks: Each book focuses on one adjective using a clear emotional or visual state.
adjective.visualApproach: Characters’ expressions and environments visually communicate meaning without needing explanation.

noun.title: The Noun Series
noun.description: Children learn how to talk about everyday objects using a single, consistent sentence pattern focused on nouns.
noun.howItWorks: Each book repeats the same sentence structure while changing only the object, helping children recognize the pattern before focusing on new vocabulary.
noun.visualApproach: Clear illustrations show the character holding or using the object, making meaning obvious without explanation.

phrases.title: The Phrase Series
phrases.description: This series introduces the most common everyday phrases children hear and use in real-life situations.
phrases.howItWorks: Each book focuses on one group of related phrases, such as introductions or classroom language, allowing children to hear natural language used as complete expressions.
phrases.visualApproach: Characters act out realistic situations where the phrases are used, helping children understand meaning through context.

howToUse.title: How to Use These Books
howToUse.intro: The Language Friends books are designed to help children learn English naturally through patterns, repetition, and visual understanding. This page explains how we recommend using the books depending on who is reading them.

pedagogy.title: Our Learning Approach
pedagogy.text: These books focus on pattern recognition rather than translation. Children learn by seeing the same sentence structure repeated with clear visual support. Grammar is introduced naturally through use, not memorization.

structure.title: How the Books Are Structured
points: Consistent sentence patterns within each series
Simple English supported by visual context
Short review and activity pages at the end
Pages with little or no Japanese to encourage independent reading

parents.title: For Parents Reading With Children
parents.text: We recommend reading the book together with your child. Show them the page clearly, read aloud, and enjoy the rhythm of the language.
tips: Use different voices for Moko, Niko, and Okja
Read slowly and naturally, even if English feels difficult
Use the images and colors to guide understanding
Katakana is there to help, but natural pronunciation is encouraged
Focus on enjoying the story rather than explaining grammar

children.title: For Children Reading Independently
children.text: Children who can read on their own are encouraged to use the books as a challenge.
tips: Look at the pictures first, then read the sentence
Use the review and activity pages to check understanding
Try reading pages without Japanese as confidence practice

bilingual.title: For Bilingual or International Children
bilingual.text: For children growing up with English and Japanese, the books support learning both languages together.
tips: Use visuals to connect meaning across languages
Notice how English patterns repeat while Japanese provides support
Exposure to hiragana, katakana, and English happens naturally
Repetition across books strengthens understanding over time

closing.text: There is no single right way to use these books. Read together, read alone, repeat pages, make voices, and have fun. The goal is comfort, confidence, and curiosity with language.
